result.markdown:
--- title: "SLU SCORE Module Pre-print Repository" --- This page contains education materials for the [SCORE Network](https://scorenetwork.org/index.html) that were created by faculty and students from the [Department of Mathematics, Computer Science, and Statistics at St. Lawrence University](https://www.stlawu.edu/offices/math-computer-science-and-statistics){target="_blank"}. The [SCORE Network](https://scorenetwork.org/index.html){target="_blank"} Module Repository enables you to search for modules by either sport (along the left), or you can browse [by statistics and data science topic](by-statsds-topic.qmd). Please note that these material have not yet completed the required pedagogical and industry peer reviews to become a published module on the SCORE Network. However, instructors are still welcome to use these materials if they are so inclined. _The development of the SCORE with Data network is funded by the National Science Foundation (award 2142705)._ **Contributing and/or Joining the SCORE Network** - If you are interested in contributing to and/or joining the SCORE Network, please check out [https://scorenetwork.org/index.html](https://scorenetwork.org/index.html){target="_blank"}. - If you are interested in creating a page similar to this to host your own "in development modules", please feel free to copy the associated Github repository: [https://github.com/iramler/slu_score_preprints](https://github.com/iramler/slu_score_preprints){target="_blank"}. + The basic structure of the this repository is to have a directory for each sport, then within the sport, each module will have a folder containing its files. For example, see the interactive diagram below (and compare it to the associated files/direcotries in the repository linked above). ::: {.cell} :::
::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: This diagram was made using the [collapsibleTree](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=collapsibleTree){target="_blank"} package.
Tips: * Be sure to modify the _quarto.yml file to match your institution's information * Notice the underscore at the beginning of the filename in the Quarto (.qmd) file in the skiing module ("_Tremblant_Cleaning_Worksheet_Key.qmd"). This is done to ensure that it isn't rendered into an html page and is instead just provided as a raw file. (Individuals willing to invest more time into customizing their _quarto.yml file can likely avoid this step.)
